user.title: Configure Zone
user.description: Set up a thermal performance analysis zone. You'll need temperature sensors, a heating entity, and the heater's declared power.

data_description.zone_name: A friendly name for this zone (e.g., Living Room, Bedroom)
data_description.outdoor_temp_sensor: Temperature sensor outside (can be shared across zones)
data_description.heating_entity: The entity that controls heating in this zone
data_description.heater_power: Nominal heater power in Watts (required for electric, optional for others)
data_description.efficiency_factor: Converts consumed energy to thermal output. Electric: 1.0, Heat pump: 2.5-4.0 (COP), Gas boiler: 0.85-0.95, Gas furnace: 0.78-0.90

dimensions.title: Room Dimensions
dimensions.description: Optional: Add room dimensions to get normalized K values (K/m² and K/m³) for comparison between rooms.

data_description.surface: Floor surface area of the zone
data_description.volume: Volume of the zone (surface × ceiling height)
data_description.power_threshold: Power above which heating is considered active (default: 50W)
data_description.window_sensor: Optional: physical window/door contact sensor for accurate open detection
data_description.weather_entity: Weather entity for wind data (shared between zones)
data_description.room_orientation: Main facade orientation to determine wind exposure
